resources.string: Why do people with disabilities need help?

People with disabilities are marginalized. About 5.5 million people with disabilities live in Poland. We tend to translate the physical characteristics of people into their personality traits, this is the so-called "halo effect," such people are treated not mediocre but extremely (idealized or incomprehensible image of a human being). The mental and physical comfort of people with disabilities is reduced compared to the average person, so it is worth helping them. These people feel lonely more often:
*Graph comparing the assessment of loneliness of a healthy person and a person with a disability.
What is the life of a person with a disability?

Treating a person with a disability as a picture of the disorder is harmful and harmful, and that person is also a human being. These people experience many problems and challenges in their lives that can lead to thoughts of suicide or even depression. Comfort of life for people with disabilities

City infrastructure is becoming more and more accessible to this social group. The architecture of apartments and buildings, the adaptation of means of transport and public space have the greatest impact on the quality of life of disabled people.
